intro: Selinocarpus lanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved selinocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its aromatic foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Selinocarpus lanceolatus thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
